speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: SCENE I. The city gate.

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: MARIANA veiled, ISABELLA, and FRIAR PETER, at their  stand. Enter DUKE VINCENTIO, VARRIUS, Lords,  ANGELO, ESCALUS, LUCIO, Provost, Officers, and Citizens, at several doors

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: My very worthy cousin, fairly met!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Our old and faithful friend, we are glad to see you.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Happy return be to your royal grace!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Many and hearty thankings to you both.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: We have made inquiry of you; and we hear

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Such goodness of your justice, that our soul

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Cannot but yield you forth to public thanks,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Forerunning more requital.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You make my bonds still greater.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: O, your desert speaks loud; and I should wrong it,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To lock it in the wards of covert bosom,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: When it deserves, with characters of brass,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: A forted residence 'gainst the tooth of time

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And razure of oblivion. Give me your hand,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And let the subject see, to make them know

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That outward courtesies would fain proclaim

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Favours that keep within. Come, Escalus,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: You must walk by us on our other hand;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And good supporters are you.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: FRIAR PETER and ISABELLA come forward

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Now is your time: speak loud and kneel before him.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Justice, O royal duke! Vail your regard

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Upon a wrong'd, I would fain have said, a maid!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O worthy prince, dishonour not your eye

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: By throwing it on any other object

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Till you have heard me in my true complaint

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And given me justice, justice, justice, justice!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Relate your wrongs; in what? by whom? be brief.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Here is Lord Angelo shall give you justice:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Reveal yourself to him.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O worthy duke,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: You bid me seek redemption of the devil:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Hear me yourself; for that which I must speak

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Must either punish me, not being believed,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Or wring redress from you. Hear me, O hear me, here!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: My lord, her wits, I fear me, are not firm:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: She hath been a suitor to me for her brother

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Cut off by course of justice,--

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: By course of justice!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And she will speak most bitterly and strange.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Most strange, but yet most truly, will I speak:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That Angelo's forsworn; is it not strange?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That Angelo's a murderer; is 't not strange?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That Angelo is an adulterous thief,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: An hypocrite, a virgin-violator;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Is it not strange and strange?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Nay, it is ten times strange.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: It is not truer he is Angelo

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Than this is all as true as it is strange:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Nay, it is ten times true; for truth is truth

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To the end of reckoning.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Away with her! Poor soul,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: She speaks this in the infirmity of sense.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O prince, I conjure thee, as thou believest

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: There is another comfort than this world,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That thou neglect me not, with that opinion

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That I am touch'd with madness! Make not impossible

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That which but seems unlike: 'tis not impossible

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But one, the wicked'st caitiff on the ground,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: May seem as shy, as grave, as just, as absolute

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As Angelo; even so may Angelo,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In all his dressings, characts, titles, forms,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Be an arch-villain; believe it, royal prince:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If he be less, he's nothing; but he's more,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Had I more name for badness.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: By mine honesty,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: If she be mad,--as I believe no other,--

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Her madness hath the oddest frame of sense,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Such a dependency of thing on thing,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: As e'er I heard in madness.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O gracious duke,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Harp not on that, nor do not banish reason

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For inequality; but let your reason serve

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To make the truth appear where it seems hid,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And hide the false seems true.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Many that are not mad

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Have, sure, more lack of reason. What would you say?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I am the sister of one Claudio,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Condemn'd upon the act of fornication

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To lose his head; condemn'd by Angelo:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I, in probation of a sisterhood,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Was sent to by my brother; one Lucio

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As then the messenger,--

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: That's I, an't like your grace:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I came to her from Claudio, and desired her

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To try her gracious fortune with Lord Angelo

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: For her poor brother's pardon.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That's he indeed.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: You were not bid to speak.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: No, my good lord;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Nor wish'd to hold my peace.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I wish you now, then;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Pray you, take note of it: and when you have

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: A business for yourself, pray heaven you then

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Be perfect.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I warrant your honour.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: The warrants for yourself; take heed to't.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: This gentleman told somewhat of my tale,--

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Right.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: It may be right; but you are i' the wrong

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To speak before your time. Proceed.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I went

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To this pernicious caitiff deputy,--

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That's somewhat madly spoken.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Pardon it;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: The phrase is to the matter.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Mended again. The matter; proceed.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In brief, to set the needless process by,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: How I persuaded, how I pray'd, and kneel'd,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: How he refell'd me, and how I replied,--

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For this was of much length,--the vile conclusion

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I now begin with grief and shame to utter:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: He would not, but by gift of my chaste body

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To his concupiscible intemperate lust,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Release my brother; and, after much debatement,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: My sisterly remorse confutes mine honour,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And I did yield to him: but the next morn betimes,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: His purpose surfeiting, he sends a warrant

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For my poor brother's head.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: This is most likely!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, that it were as like as it is true!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: By heaven, fond wretch, thou knowist not what thou speak'st,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Or else thou art suborn'd against his honour

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: In hateful practise. First, his integrity

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Stands without blemish. Next, it imports no reason

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That with such vehemency he should pursue

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Faults proper to himself: if he had so offended,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: He would have weigh'd thy brother by himself

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And not have cut him off. Some one hath set you on:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Confess the truth, and say by whose advice

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thou camest here to complain.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And is this all?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Then, O you blessed ministers above,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Keep me in patience, and with ripen'd time

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Unfold the evil which is here wrapt up

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In countenance! Heaven shield your grace from woe,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As I, thus wrong'd, hence unbelieved go!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I know you'ld fain be gone. An officer!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To prison with her! Shall we thus permit

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: A blasting and a scandalous breath to fall

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: On him so near us? This needs must be a practise.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Who knew of Your intent and coming hither?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: One that I would were here, Friar Lodowick.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: A ghostly father, belike. Who knows that Lodowick?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: My lord, I know him; 'tis a meddling friar;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I do not like the man: had he been lay, my lord

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: For certain words he spake against your grace

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: In your retirement, I had swinged him soundly.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Words against me? this is a good friar, belike!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And to set on this wretched woman here

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Against our substitute! Let this friar be found.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: But yesternight, my lord, she and that friar,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I saw them at the prison: a saucy friar,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: A very scurvy fellow.

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Blessed be your royal grace!

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: I have stood by, my lord, and I have heard

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Your royal ear abused. First, hath this woman

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Most wrongfully accused your substitute,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Who is as free from touch or soil with her

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: As she from one ungot.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: We did believe no less.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Know you that Friar Lodowick that she speaks of?

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: I know him for a man divine and holy;

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Not scurvy, nor a temporary meddler,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: As he's reported by this gentleman;

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: And, on my trust, a man that never yet

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Did, as he vouches, misreport your grace.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: My lord, most villanously; believe it.

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Well, he in time may come to clear himself;

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: But at this instant he is sick my lord,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Of a strange fever. Upon his mere request,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Being come to knowledge that there was complaint

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Intended 'gainst Lord Angelo, came I hither,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: To speak, as from his mouth, what he doth know

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Is true and false; and what he with his oath

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: And all probation will make up full clear,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Whensoever he's convented. First, for this woman.

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: To justify this worthy nobleman,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: So vulgarly and personally accused,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Her shall you hear disproved to her eyes,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Till she herself confess it.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Good friar, let's hear it.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: ISABELLA is carried off guarded; and MARIANA comes forward

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Do you not smile at this, Lord Angelo?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: O heaven, the vanity of wretched fools!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Give us some seats. Come, cousin Angelo;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: In this I'll be impartial; be you judge

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Of your own cause. Is this the witness, friar?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: First, let her show her face, and after speak.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Pardon, my lord; I will not show my face

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Until my husband bid me.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: What, are you married?

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: No, my lord.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Are you a maid?

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: No, my lord.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: A widow, then?

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Neither, my lord.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Why, you are nothing then: neither maid, widow, nor wife?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: My lord, she may be a punk; for many of them are

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: neither maid, widow, nor wife.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Silence that fellow: I would he had some cause

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To prattle for himself.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Well, my lord.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: My lord; I do confess I ne'er was married;

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: And I confess besides I am no maid:

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: I have known my husband; yet my husband

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Knows not that ever he knew me.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He was drunk then, my lord: it can be no better.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For the benefit of silence, would thou wert so too!

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Well, my lord.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: This is no witness for Lord Angelo.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Now I come to't my lord

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: She that accuses him of fornication,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: In self-same manner doth accuse my husband,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: And charges him my lord, with such a time

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: When I'll depose I had him in mine arms

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: With all the effect of love.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Charges she more than me?

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Not that I know.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: No? you say your husband.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Why, just, my lord, and that is Angelo,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Who thinks he knows that he ne'er knew my body,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: But knows he thinks that he knows Isabel's.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: This is a strange abuse. Let's see thy face.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: My husband bids me; now I will unmask.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Unveiling

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: This is that face, thou cruel Angelo,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Which once thou sworest was worth the looking on;

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: This is the hand which, with a vow'd contract,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Was fast belock'd in thine; this is the body

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: That took away the match from Isabel,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: And did supply thee at thy garden-house

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: In her imagined person.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Know you this woman?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Carnally, she says.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Sirrah, no more!

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Enough, my lord.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: My lord, I must confess I know this woman:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And five years since there was some speech of marriage

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Betwixt myself and her; which was broke off,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Partly for that her promised proportions

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Came short of composition, but in chief

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: For that her reputation was disvalued

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: In levity: since which time of five years

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I never spake with her, saw her, nor heard from her,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Upon my faith and honour.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Noble prince,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: As there comes light from heaven and words from breath,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: As there is sense in truth and truth in virtue,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: I am affianced this man's wife as strongly

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: As words could make up vows: and, my good lord,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: But Tuesday night last gone in's garden-house

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: He knew me as a wife. As this is true,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Let me in safety raise me from my knees

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Or else for ever be confixed here,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: A marble monument!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I did but smile till now:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Now, good my lord, give me the scope of justice

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: My patience here is touch'd. I do perceive

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: These poor informal women are no more

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: But instruments of some more mightier member

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That sets them on: let me have way, my lord,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To find this practise out.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Ay, with my heart

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And punish them to your height of pleasure.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thou foolish friar, and thou pernicious woman,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Compact with her that's gone, think'st thou thy oaths,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Though they would swear down each particular saint,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Were testimonies against his worth and credit

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That's seal'd in approbation? You, Lord Escalus,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Sit with my cousin; lend him your kind pains

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To find out this abuse, whence 'tis derived.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: There is another friar that set them on;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Let him be sent for.

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Would he were here, my lord! for he indeed

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Hath set the women on to this complaint:

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Your provost knows the place where he abides

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: And he may fetch him.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Go do it instantly.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exit Provost

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And you, my noble and well-warranted cousin,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Whom it concerns to hear this matter forth,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Do with your injuries as seems you best,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: In any chastisement: I for a while will leave you;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: But stir not you till you have well determined

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Upon these slanderers.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: My lord, we'll do it throughly.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Exit DUKE

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Signior Lucio, did not you say you knew that

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Friar Lodowick to be a dishonest person?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: 'Cucullus non facit monachum:' honest in nothing

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: but in his clothes; and one that hath spoke most

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: villanous speeches of the duke.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: We shall entreat you to abide here till he come and

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: enforce them against him: we shall find this friar a

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: notable fellow.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As any in Vienna, on my word.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Call that same Isabel here once again; I would speak with her.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Pray you, my lord, give me leave to question; you

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: shall see how I'll handle her.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Not better than he, by her own report.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Say you?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Marry, sir, I think, if you handled her privately,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: she would sooner confess: perchance, publicly,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: she'll be ashamed.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: I will go darkly to work with her.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: That's the way; for women are light at midnight.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Re-enter Officers with ISABELLA; and Provost with the DUKE VINCENTIO in his friar's habit

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Come on, mistress: here's a gentlewoman denies all

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: that you have said.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: My lord, here comes the rascal I spoke of; here with

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: the provost.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: In very good time: speak not you to him till we

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: call upon you.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Mum.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Come, sir: did you set these women on to slander

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Lord Angelo? they have confessed you did.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: 'Tis false.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: How! know you where you are?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Respect to your great place! and let the devil

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Be sometime honour'd for his burning throne!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Where is the duke? 'tis he should hear me speak.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: The duke's in us; and we will hear you speak:

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Look you speak justly.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Boldly, at least. But, O, poor souls,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Come you to seek the lamb here of the fox?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Good night to your redress! Is the duke gone?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Then is your cause gone too. The duke's unjust,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thus to retort your manifest appeal,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And put your trial in the villain's mouth

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Which here you come to accuse.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: This is the rascal; this is he I spoke of.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Why, thou unreverend and unhallow'd friar,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Is't not enough thou hast suborn'd these women

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: To accuse this worthy man, but, in foul mouth

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: And in the witness of his proper ear,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: To call him villain? and then to glance from him

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: To the duke himself, to tax him with injustice?

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Take him hence; to the rack with him! We'll touse you

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Joint by joint, but we will know his purpose.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: What 'unjust'!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Be not so hot; the duke

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Dare no more stretch this finger of mine than he

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Dare rack his own: his subject am I not,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Nor here provincial. My business in this state

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Made me a looker on here in Vienna,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Where I have seen corruption boil and bubble

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Till it o'er-run the stew; laws for all faults,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: But faults so countenanced, that the strong statutes

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Stand like the forfeits in a barber's shop,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: As much in mock as mark.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Slander to the state! Away with him to prison!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: What can you vouch against him, Signior Lucio?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Is this the man that you did tell us of?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: 'Tis he, my lord. Come hither, goodman baldpate:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: do you know me?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I remember you, sir, by the sound of your voice: I

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: met you at the prison, in the absence of the duke.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: O, did you so? And do you remember what you said of the duke?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Most notedly, sir.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Do you so, sir? And was the duke a fleshmonger, a

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: fool, and a coward, as you then reported him to be?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: You must, sir, change persons with me, ere you make

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: that my report: you, indeed, spoke so of him; and

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: much more, much worse.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: O thou damnable fellow! Did not I pluck thee by the

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: nose for thy speeches?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I protest I love the duke as I love myself.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Hark, how the villain would close now, after his

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: treasonable abuses!

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Such a fellow is not to be talked withal. Away with

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: him to prison! Where is the provost? Away with him

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: to prison! lay bolts enough upon him: let him

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: speak no more. Away with those giglots too, and

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: with the other confederate companion!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: [To Provost]  Stay, sir; stay awhile.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: What, resists he? Help him, Lucio.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Come, sir; come, sir; come, sir; foh, sir! Why, you

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: bald-pated, lying rascal, you must be hooded, must

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: you? Show your knave's visage, with a pox to you!

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: show your sheep-biting face, and be hanged an hour!

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Will't not off?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Pulls off the friar's hood, and discovers DUKE VINCENTIO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thou art the first knave that e'er madest a duke.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: First, provost, let me bail these gentle three.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To LUCIO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Sneak not away, sir; for the friar and you

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Must have a word anon. Lay hold on him.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: This may prove worse than hanging.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: [To ESCALUS]  What you have spoke I pardon: sit you down:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: We'll borrow place of him.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To ANGELO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Sir, by your leave.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Hast thou or word, or wit, or impudence,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That yet can do thee office? If thou hast,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Rely upon it till my tale be heard,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And hold no longer out.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: O my dread lord,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I should be guiltier than my guiltiness,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To think I can be undiscernible,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When I perceive your grace, like power divine,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Hath look'd upon my passes. Then, good prince,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: No longer session hold upon my shame,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: But let my trial be mine own confession:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Immediate sentence then and sequent death

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Is all the grace I beg.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Come hither, Mariana.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Say, wast thou e'er contracted to this woman?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I was, my lord.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Go take her hence, and marry her instantly.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Do you the office, friar; which consummate,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Return him here again. Go with him, provost.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exeunt ANGELO, MARIANA, FRIAR PETER and Provost

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: My lord, I am more amazed at his dishonour

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Than at the strangeness of it.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Come hither, Isabel.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Your friar is now your prince: as I was then

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Advertising and holy to your business,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Not changing heart with habit, I am still

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Attorney'd at your service.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, give me pardon,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That I, your vassal, have employ'd and pain'd

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Your unknown sovereignty!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: You are pardon'd, Isabel:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And now, dear maid, be you as free to us.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Your brother's death, I know, sits at your heart;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And you may marvel why I obscured myself,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Labouring to save his life, and would not rather

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Make rash remonstrance of my hidden power

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Than let him so be lost. O most kind maid,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: It was the swift celerity of his death,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Which I did think with slower foot came on,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That brain'd my purpose. But, peace be with him!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That life is better life, past fearing death,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Than that which lives to fear: make it your comfort,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: So happy is your brother.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I do, my lord.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Re-enter ANGELO, MARIANA, FRIAR PETER, and Provost

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For this new-married man approaching here,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Whose salt imagination yet hath wrong'd

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Your well defended honour, you must pardon

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For Mariana's sake: but as he adjudged your brother,--

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Being criminal, in double violation

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Of sacred chastity and of promise-breach

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thereon dependent, for your brother's life,--

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: The very mercy of the law cries out

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Most audible, even from his proper tongue,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: 'An Angelo for Claudio, death for death!'

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Haste still pays haste, and leisure answers leisure;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Like doth quit like, and MEASURE still FOR MEASURE.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Then, Angelo, thy fault's thus manifested;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Which, though thou wouldst deny, denies thee vantage.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: We do condemn thee to the very block

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Where Claudio stoop'd to death, and with like haste.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Away with him!

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: O my most gracious lord,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: I hope you will not mock me with a husband.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: It is your husband mock'd you with a husband.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Consenting to the safeguard of your honour,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I thought your marriage fit; else imputation,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For that he knew you, might reproach your life

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And choke your good to come; for his possessions,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Although by confiscation they are ours,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: We do instate and widow you withal,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To buy you a better husband.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: O my dear lord,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: I crave no other, nor no better man.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Never crave him; we are definitive.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Gentle my liege,--

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Kneeling

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: You do but lose your labour.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Away with him to death!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To LUCIO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Now, sir, to you.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: O my good lord! Sweet Isabel, take my part;

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Lend me your knees, and all my life to come

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: I'll lend you all my life to do you service.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Against all sense you do importune her:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Should she kneel down in mercy of this fact,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Her brother's ghost his paved bed would break,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And take her hence in horror.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Isabel,

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Sweet Isabel, do yet but kneel by me;

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Hold up your hands, say nothing; I'll speak all.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: They say, best men are moulded out of faults;

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: And, for the most, become much more the better

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: For being a little bad: so may my husband.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: O Isabel, will you not lend a knee?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: He dies for Claudio's death.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Most bounteous sir,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Kneeling

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Look, if it please you, on this man condemn'd,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As if my brother lived: I partly think

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: A due sincerity govern'd his deeds,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Till he did look on me: since it is so,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Let him not die. My brother had but justice,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In that he did the thing for which he died:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For Angelo,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: His act did not o'ertake his bad intent,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And must be buried but as an intent

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That perish'd by the way: thoughts are no subjects;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Intents but merely thoughts.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Merely, my lord.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Your suit's unprofitable; stand up, I say.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I have bethought me of another fault.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Provost, how came it Claudio was beheaded

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: At an unusual hour?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: It was commanded so.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Had you a special warrant for the deed?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: No, my good lord; it was by private message.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For which I do discharge you of your office:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Give up your keys.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Pardon me, noble lord:

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I thought it was a fault, but knew it not;

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Yet did repent me, after more advice;

speaker: Provost
text_entry: For testimony whereof, one in the prison,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: That should by private order else have died,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I have reserved alive.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: What's he?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: His name is Barnardine.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I would thou hadst done so by Claudio.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Go fetch him hither; let me look upon him.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exit Provost

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: I am sorry, one so learned and so wise

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: As you, Lord Angelo, have still appear'd,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Should slip so grossly, both in the heat of blood.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: And lack of temper'd judgment afterward.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I am sorry that such sorrow I procure:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And so deep sticks it in my penitent heart

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That I crave death more willingly than mercy;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: 'Tis my deserving, and I do entreat it.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Re-enter Provost, with BARNARDINE, CLAUDIO muffled, and JULIET

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Which is that Barnardine?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: This, my lord.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: There was a friar told me of this man.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Sirrah, thou art said to have a stubborn soul.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That apprehends no further than this world,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And squarest thy life according. Thou'rt condemn'd:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: But, for those earthly faults, I quit them all;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And pray thee take this mercy to provide

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For better times to come. Friar, advise him;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I leave him to your hand. What muffled fellow's that?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: This is another prisoner that I saved.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Who should have died when Claudio lost his head;

speaker: Provost
text_entry: As like almost to Claudio as himself.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Unmuffles CLAUDIO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: [To ISABELLA]  If he be like your brother, for his sake

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Is he pardon'd; and, for your lovely sake,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Give me your hand and say you will be mine.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: He is my brother too: but fitter time for that.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: By this Lord Angelo perceives he's safe;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Methinks I see a quickening in his eye.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Well, Angelo, your evil quits you well:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Look that you love your wife; her worth worth yours.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I find an apt remission in myself;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And yet here's one in place I cannot pardon.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To LUCIO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: You, sirrah, that knew me for a fool, a coward,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: One all of luxury, an ass, a madman;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Wherein have I so deserved of you,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That you extol me thus?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: 'Faith, my lord. I spoke it but according to the

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: trick. If you will hang me for it, you may; but I

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: had rather it would please you I might be whipt.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Whipt first, sir, and hanged after.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Proclaim it, provost, round about the city.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Is any woman wrong'd by this lewd fellow,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: As I have heard him swear himself there's one

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Whom he begot with child, let her appear,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And he shall marry her: the nuptial finish'd,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Let him be whipt and hang'd.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I beseech your highness, do not marry me to a whore.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Your highness said even now, I made you a duke:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: good my lord, do not recompense me in making me a cuckold.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Upon mine honour, thou shalt marry her.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thy slanders I forgive; and therewithal

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Remit thy other forfeits. Take him to prison;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And see our pleasure herein executed.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Marrying a punk, my lord, is pressing to death,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: whipping, and hanging.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Slandering a prince deserves it.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exit Officers with LUCIO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: She, Claudio, that you wrong'd, look you restore.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Joy to you, Mariana! Love her, Angelo:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I have confess'd her and I know her virtue.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thanks, good friend Escalus, for thy much goodness:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: There's more behind that is more gratulate.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thanks, provost, for thy care and secrecy:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: We shill employ thee in a worthier place.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Forgive him, Angelo, that brought you home

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: The head of Ragozine for Claudio's:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: The offence pardons itself. Dear Isabel,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I have a motion much imports your good;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Whereto if you'll a willing ear incline,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: What's mine is yours and what is yours is mine.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: So, bring us to our palace; where we'll show

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: What's yet behind, that's meet you all should know.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exeunt
